etymology.description: Semantic: 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") + Phonetic: 曷(曷) (hē) = incorporates mouth element for drinking + phonetic cue -> drink
etymology.interpretation: The character 喝(hē, "drink") uses 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") to signify the act of drinking, logically involving the mouth. The phonetic component 曷(曷) (hē) suggests the pronunciation.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢喝茶(我喜歡喝茶)。
他喝了一杯果汁(他喝了一杯果汁)，享受下午时光(享受下午時光)。
examples.pinyin: Tā hēle yī bēi guǒzhī, xiǎngshòu xiàwǔ shíguāng.
examples.english: He drank a glass of juice and enjoyed the afternoon.
